fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Configuring issue sources (while making no changes to projects) then going back to plan, will reinstate previously removed (excluded) releases.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Releases view
# Find release, go to ... then select Remove and remove from Plan
# Review changes > Save selected changes in Jira
# Go to Configure > Issue Sources (leave sources unchanged) > Back to plan

OR
# Go to Exclusion rules
# Selected all old releases for a project > Exclude
# Go back to plan, all excluded releases are not present in the plan
# Go to Configure > Click on Issue Sources > Back to plan > All the excluded releases are back

h3. Expected Results
Excluded (removed) releases are not reintroduced upon viewing the issue sources > going back to plan.

h3. Actual Results
They are reinstated/restored as if you hadn't removed them previously.

h3. Workaround
Go back and remove the releases or exclude them from the plan again - being careful not to go back into issue sources > back to plan
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps - viewing Issue sources then going back to plan ignores previously removed (excluded) releases

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The customer removed a Board, where the sprint was created, the sprint was shared on multiple boards and the sprint was closed, now they want to re-open the sprint but they get this error --> The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a sprint, share it with a few boards, delete the board where the sprint was created then try to re-open the sprint in one of the boards where the sprint was shared.

h3. Expected Results
You should not have the option to re-open the sprint or you should be able to re-open the sprint without any issues.
h3. Actual Results
You are unable to re-open the sprint and you receive the following error:
The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Create a new sprint, and move all the issues to that sprint.
fields.summary: Sprint re-opening issues if the board where the sprint was created is removed.

fields.description:
H2. Description

Currently in Advanced Roadmaps the sprint capacity view doesn't reflect the assigned capacity in the following scenario:
* Configure the plan as hours-based estimation
* Set estimates on a story and one or more subtasks
* Assign the Story to the Sprint in AR
* The sprint capacity view will now have sprint contents incremented to reflect the story estimate but not the estimate on the subtasks.
* Now review changes and accept the change into Jira
* The sprint capacity view will now have sprint contents incremented to reflect the story estimate and subtasks estimate.

→ Currently subtask capacity only reflected in the sprint capacity after reviewing and accepting changes

h2. Suggestion:
Subtask capacity to be reflected in the sprint capacity without having to Review and Accept changes
fields.summary: Subtask capacity to be reflected in the sprint capacity view without having to Review and Accept changes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

Currently, Jira allows user to overlap dates (Start Date / End Date) even when issues are dependent between each other.
h3. Expected Results

A warning message should be shown. By now, a warning message is only shown in Dependencies Report and in Timeline the badge will turn red to indicate that the dates of this dependency don’t line up.
h3. Actual Results

The overlapping of dates are not blocked. The setting of sequential / concurrent is only directly considered if you use Auto-Schedule feature.
fields.summary: Dependent issues should not allow overlapping dates when value is manually set in the plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you've estimated issues that go over the team's capacity limit (eg. story points= 60 when the team's limit is 30 pts), the auto-scheduler will sometimes force those issues into the next future/planned Sprints available.

h3. Proposed solution

The auto-scheduler finds issues way over the team's capacity limit, it should split that issue into multiple projected Sprints with the appropriate pts for each one.

For example, if the team's limit is 30 pts and the issue is estimated at 125 pts, the issue should be scheduled into multiple projected Sprints whilst splitting the estimation points

* Planned Sprint: 30 pts
* Projected Sprint 1: 30 pts
* Projected Sprint 2: 30 pts
* Projected Sprint 3: 30 pts
* Projected Sprint 4: 5 pts

h3. Workaround

Though this won't be applicable for some cases, by already creating your future Sprints in advance and scheduling your issues (Start date/Due date) in the same period as those Sprints, the auto-scheduler will try to split the estimation of the issue across multiple future Sprints which should help with going over the capacity limit.
fields.summary: Overestimated issues should be split across multiple project Sprints

fields.description:
When a board swimlane is based on *Stories*, the tooltip with options (Top of swimlane, Bottom of swimlane) is displayed for parent issues as well.

Since nested ranking is not supported, users cannot mov stories to the top of or bottom of the swimlane when swimlanes are based on *Stories* so tooltip should not be shown when clicked on parent tasks.
fields.summary: Swimlane tooltip should not be shown for parent issue when swimlanes are based on stories

fields.description: I believe that the ability to create sub-tasks direclty under an epic woudl be beneficial on the new issue view.
fields.summary: Create more Subtasks straight under an Epic

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users with Viewer only permission are able to view and interact with the *Create Plan* button while on the Plan List.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 Remove all your permissions/groups from the Plan settings except for the *Advanced Roadmaps Viewer* permission
 !permissions.png|thumbnail!
 # Step 2
 Access the *View All Plans* option of the Plans

h3. Expected Results

If the user is not part of the *Advanced Roadmaps User* permission the *Create Plan* button should not be displayed
h3. Actual Results

If the user is not part of the *Advanced Roadmaps User* the *Create Plan* button is displayed and interactive but when the user clicks on the Save button it loads infinitely.
 [^create.png]

!image-2021-09-23-10-51-15-275.png|width=1055,height=142! 
 !save.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround found.
fields.summary: Viewer only users are able to see and interact with Create Plan on Plan List

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a subtask is changed to a Story (and that subtask was in a sprint), the issue (which is now a Story) does not show in the Sprint Report. The sprint field in the Story still shows the sprint, and the change of the issue type (as well as the removal from the sprint) is documented in the issue history.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Add a Task with a Sub-task to a sprint
 # Start sprint
 # Check sprint report - Sub-task will be included
 # Change the sub-task issue type to Story
 # Check sprint report (issue number will no longer be listed)
 # Check sprint field on sub-task, sprint field will still be populated
 # Check issue history, it shows the issue type change from sub-task to Story, as well as the removal from the sprint


h3. Expected Results

Either when the sub-task changes to a story, the issue is completely removed from the sprint or is completely retained in the sprint (and visible in the sprint report)

h3. Actual Results

Sub-task changed to Story and is no longer shown in the sprint report, and the sprint field in the Story is populated with the sprint

h3. Workaround

Remove the sprint from the sprint field in the Story, and re-add the sprint. This will cause the Story to show in the sprint report.
fields.summary: Changing issue type from sub-task to Story removes issue from sprint report, but sprint field is still populated

fields.description:
Reference this Community Post for more information:

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/In-a-Next-Gen-Project-is-there-a-way-to-make-a-custom-field-read/qaq-p/1578941
fields.summary: For Team-managed projects, allow a custom field to be read only.

fields.description:
Implement the ability to open and issues in the plan itself instead of opening it in a new tab.

The implementation could be similar to opening an issue in board as a pop up or like a sidebar view in the backlog.
fields.summary: Ability to open an issue in the plan instead of a new tab

fields.description:
I will try to describe my suggestion as swiftly as possible.



+*Issue:*+

After archiving a project it should be possible to restore a project, hence the linked issue type schemes, screen schemes and workflows schemes are kept as well. The project is archived 'As is'
This is the right approach in my opinion, however how the archived workflow schemes, workflows, types and so on are still kept in the active section.
As a person who endorses "clean desk" policy this is a pain to the eyes.
Also if workflows and type scheme's change, there probably is good reason to it, so restoring old projects should, in my opinion, always leed to a migration, or at least the open question whether the old schemes should be restored or migrated to the newer versions of those flows.
Should there be versioning of workflows? well it is proper management to version SOPs but let's not push this too fa..

+*Suggestion:*+

1) keep archived workflows, issue types, schemes, not in the active section but move them to the inactive or even a new "archived" section

2) when restoring an archived project ask for the project to be migrated to the actual active schemes or optionally to restore the old schemes.
fields.summary: Archived projects & Workflows

fields.description:
When reviewing the issue from the filters, eg via the link (https://********.atlassian.net/browse/JPM-5?filter=10054), a big margin with extra white space is added as shown in the screenshot. This makes the issue view section too small and hard to read if the issue description is long. 

 !BigMargin.png|thumbnail! 

Whereas when viewing the same issue directly, eg via the link (https://********.atlassian.net/browse/JPM-5), the page is rendered well. 

 !GoodOne.png|thumbnail! 

The customer would like to have the unified UI interface across all views.
fields.summary: Viewing the issue from filter menu leaves the big margin between frames

fields.description:
When using hours-based estimation and having estimates applying to both stories and subtasks, if the hierarchy filter is set to Epic -> Story, then the sprint capacity does not include subtasks (as it is not included in the hierarchy filter).

Some users expect that the sprint capacity reflects the capacity as per plan rather than just the capacity. that matches the hierarchy filter used.

Workaround at this stage is to remove all filters or include Epic -> Subtasks.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps sprint capacity doesn't include subtasks unless included in the hierarchy filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Boards are not loading. The issue is seen with both Scrum and Kanban boards.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Access Jira project Boards

h3. Expected Results
Boards should load 
h3. Actual Results
Boards don't load as expected. The issue seems to be intermittent and doesn't seem to be browser-specific.


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Boards are not loading or very slow

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to use some smart values with DevOps triggers in Jira automation like {{intiator}}. 

This would be very helpful when trying to add an user to a custom field when using this trigger.
fields.summary: Support more smart values for DevOps triggers in Automation

fields.description:
As many mentioned here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/DevOps-Articles/Use-Code-in-Jira-to-connect-Git-tools-Use-Deployments-in-Jira-to/ba-p/1547988]

We need the seamless integration of Github Action and Jira Deployment features.
fields.summary: To enable integration with Github Action for Deployment Features

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After creating a Scrum board with sample data, and try to perform the "Move issues to sprint and rank" REST API, you'll encounter a 400 error: The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.

This only happens in the REST API, in the UI it works. 

You may check that sample sprints don’t have a value for the “originBoardId” parameter, which can definitely be the cause of the bug. Therefore, a possible workaround would be to include this parameter.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a sample Scrum board with sample data (Your Work → Boards → View all boards → Create board → Create a Scrum board with sample data).
 # Use the "Move issues to sprint and rank" public REST API (POST /rest/agile/1.0/sprint/\{sprintId}/issue) to move an issue from the backlog to the active sprint on this board. Link of the API request: [Move issues to sprint|[https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/7.0.4/#agile/1.0/sprint-moveIssuesToSprint].]
 # Check that sample sprint don't have the "originBoardId", by making an API request to get all sprints [Get all boards|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/7.0.4/#agile/1.0/board/\{boardId}/sprint-getAllSprints]

h3. Expected Results
Move the issue to the sprint
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the response of the REST API HTTP 400 is returned with the error message:
{noformat}
"The requested board cannot be viewed because it either does not exist or you do not have permission to view it."
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

A possible workaround would be to add the "originBoardId" to sample sprints.
fields.summary: Move issues to sprint API request doesn't work with sample sprints

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to add a quick filter which displays a drop-down for all possible values for a field. Similar to Assignee filter.

For example, I'd like to add a filter based on Team, Fix version or Priority. Today it's necessary to define separated filter for each value.

!image-2021-09-16-16-10-52-904.png!
fields.summary: Quick filters which displays a drop-down for each value for a field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating issues in the Roadmap with required fields having default value triggers create modal

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Mark a field as required. Ensure there is a default value set for the custom field.
# Add the field to the Create issue screen
# Create an issue in the Roadmap section

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be created

h3. Actual Results

Create issue modal opens, opting Create option creates the issue successfully.

h3. Workaround

Mark the field as Optional or set a default value.
fields.summary: Creating issues in the Roadmap with required fields having default value triggers create modal

fields.description:
When you clone a story the system places a prefix of CLONE on the Story name and the linked Sub Task names for the newly created story/tasks.  Depending on how many times you clone something there could be MANY CLONE prefixes on each story/task.  The user then either has to ignore them all or edit each and every one of them to remove this prefix.  

Is there any way to either prevent the prefix from being added to each story/subtask or have the system automatically remove them when cloning?  

I was able to find references to an automated rule/process that might help.  See the following for an example.  There are other links & information out there on how to deal with this if you run a google search.

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Need-to-remove-quot-Clone-quot-prefix-from-many-subtasks/qaq-p/1729276]

 

My project is CBBAR but there are others in my group that may like this changed as well.
fields.summary: Remove CLONE prefix from Sub Tasks when cloning

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian Team,

by now, almost all apps come with a dark mode. Be it Google,

!image-2021-09-15-08-39-19-983.png|width=430,height=229!

Be it the Microsoft 365 admin center,

!image-2021-09-15-08-40-36-949.png|width=432,height=211!

Even onenote and outlook have a proper dark mode nowadays:

!image-2021-09-15-08-44-00-494.png|width=438,height=202!

!image-2021-09-15-08-45-14-589.png|width=453,height=141!

And then you come around and see this:
!image-2021-09-15-08-47-26-667.png|width=555,height=312!

I urge you to fix this. A paid third party plugin is not the solution I am looking for. You are litterally hurting your customers eyes. If only my company wouldnt use jira, I would use other tools which have the capabilities for dark mode...
fields.summary: Dark Mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The start date of the epic bar appears off by a day when dragged to the start of the column on the roadmap timeline. 

The dates still get correctly updated on the issue, though, and a page refresh fixes the visual misalignment.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a roadmap
 # Move an epic bar of an issue on the timeline in the Month mode, try to align the issue with the start of the month).

h3. Expected Results

The epic bar's start date should be the 1st of the month.
h3. Actual Results

The epic bar's start date shows last day of the previous month.
h3. Workaround
 # Refresh the page after epics have been dragged to their desired position to resolve the visual discrepancy
fields.summary: Dragging an epic bar near the start of the column on roadmap causes the bar to be off by a day

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Full Githib sync and the commit sync are failing using the Github for Jira app

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attempt a full sync or commit sync using the app

h3. Expected Results
The sync should be successfull

h3. Actual Results
The sync is failing after multiple attempts

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Full Github sync and the commit sync are failing using the Github for Jira app

fields.description:
Due to new changes from [ Configure filters|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/configure-filters/]. The kanban board will have a default setting to hide issue which are closed for more than 2 weeks. 

{quote}
(Kanban only) Hiding completed issues
To improve your board's performance, all issues in the Done column which weren't updated within the last 2 weeks are hidden. You can change this time period, or choose to always show all issues.{quote}

h4. Current Behavior
*Hide completed issues older than* option will have 2 weeks configured as the default value. 

h4. Suggestion
Set this to "Show all" rather than 2 weeks to allow flexibility for the customer to toggle it when there's a necessary.
fields.summary: Set the default value to "Show all" closed ticket from the board settings.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issues in the Done status are not being removed from the Kanban boards after the set amount of weeks passed.

*Hide completed issues older than* function should hide issues whose *ResolutionDate* are older than the selection supplied by the user without considering if the Issue was updated after that date.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 - Create an Issue and set it to Done status.
 # Step 2 - After one to four weeks depending on the board settings, it will disappear.
 # Step 3 - Edit and do a change on the issue.

h3. Expected Results
The issue will not be displayed on the board.

h3. Actual Results
The issue is displayed on the board. And the *Hide completed issues older than* counter is reset.

h3. Workaround
Do not edit an Issue once set to Done status.
fields.summary: Hide completed issues older than Feature on Kanban Boards not working as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When *Epics Panel* is enabled in the Kanban board settings, changing the Epic color in the backlog does not get reflected / sync on the Kanban board.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Board Settings
 # Select Columns
 # Enable *Epics Panel*
 # Go to Backlog open the Epic section and change the Epic color
 # Go to Kanban board the Epic color has not changed

h3. Expected Results

Epic colors sync between the backlog and Kanban board
h3. Actual Results

Epic colors do not sync between the backlog and Kanban board
h3. Workaround

Open another Board refresh and then open the Kanban board
fields.summary: When Epics Panel is enabled in the Kanban board settings,  changing the Epic color it does not get reflected on the Kanban board

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm not sure if your team has come across this concept of using JIRA ticket IDs as a reference within code as an external user experience ID reference when handling error responses that need to be passed upstream from the originating SW component.

There are so many benefits from referencing a Jira ticket because of all the Jira related metrics.  

I've done this concept at a former company, and was hoping to do this same design concept at my current company.  My former company is still using Jira IDs as an externalUxID reference because of how much is speeds up the support and issue handling process.

My current company has chosen to not do this because of hesitation with integrating JIRA's feature set in.  As you can image there are lessons people have learned about integrating in external IDs in code.  But this is different because it is workflow management maintaining metrics from before and after the code is implemented and deployed.

The teams only reason for not adopting this concept, I pushed forward, was because of the "Jira project feature" to achieve a project board.  They were worried about losing the Jira ticket ID linkages and for those ids to have been referenced in code.

I was wondering if you could market a concept of  JIRA externalUxIDs to promote all the benefits around this concept and to enable another feature in your Jira cloud that says a Jira board is being used for as a reference as externalUxIDs in code.  This would stop the Project's archive process from making all the JIRA links disabled, and stop any re-ordering of the IDs.

In the shorter term if there is another way to stop the archiving that causes Jira links to not be referenceable, this might be a solution I could use.

 

I hope your Jira team is truly listening to this feedback. 

And I'd like to talk to a Jira representative more about this suggestion to help you, help me and many other companies that don't recognize your value.  

Thank you for your time,

Regards,

~Michael V. Liguori
fields.summary: Creating and marketing a new JIRA Project integration concept for code called JIRA externalUxIDs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The board cards are misaligned to the bords when dragging and dropping on Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Jira Cloud Instance on Firefox
 # Pull up any scrum board and navigate to the active sprints' tab
 # Try to drag and drop any card into another state
 # You can see that the outline of the columns is misaligned between the columns and the drop

h3. Expected Results

For the UI to be consistent across boards regardless of the browser you access from.
 !Pasted Graphic 6.png|width=448,height=205!
h3. Actual Results

!jira_issue_hover.png|width=639,height=261!
h3. Workaround

This problem doesn't happen when using Chrome
fields.summary: Drag and drop on Scrum board on firefox has unaligned boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating a Kanban project board and selecting the "*Create a board >> Board from an existing project*" option, the default Jira filter in use *(project = <insert_pkey> ORDER BY Rank ASC)* is not correctly leveraged when in regards to the imported issue statuses that are associated to the board columns.
h3. How to reproduce
 # On any project board page, choose 'Create Board'
 # Select 'Create Kanban Board'
 # Select 'Create a board >> Board from an existing project'
 # Fill in required fields for target project
 # 'Create Board'
 # Select 'Board Settings' of newly created board
 # Select 'Columns' 

h3. Expected behavior

When completing the actions above, the expected behavior is that *only statuses that are included on the target project* are added to the board columns. 

Looking at the board settings a very basic JQL filter is created and leveraged in creating the board *(project = <insert_pkey> ORDER BY Rank ASC).*

This would lead the user to believe that only statues leveraged in the target project 'Issue Types' and 'Workflow' should be added to the board. This is not the case. 
h3. Observed behaviour 

When creating the board, all statuses that are mentioned in the assigned project '*Workflow Scheme*' are added to the board. Not just those in the assigned project Workflow. 

For example ->

If a project leverages this Scheme:

!JSWCLOUD-21893 - Ex. Scheme.png|thumbnail!

But, the project *does not* include all issue types included in that scheme:

!JSWCLOUD-21893 - Ex. Settings.png|thumbnail!

The Statuses of all issue types in the *Scheme* are added to the board:

Correct Statuses based on *Issue Type*: !JSWCLOUD-21893 - Ex. Workflow (1).png|thumbnail!      Incorrect based on *Workflow* *Schemes*: !JSWCLOUD-21893 - Ex. Workflow (2).png|thumbnail!

We can see that all Statuses referenced in the Scheme are added to the board, not just those in the Issue Types associated to the Project's Workflow and Issue Types. 

!JSWCLOUD-21893 - Ex. Columns.png|thumbnail!
h3. Potential Workaround

Create the Kanban board by choosing *Board from an existing Saved Filter* and building the filter to only include Issue Types associated with the target project.
{code:java}
project = "<insert-pkey>" AND issuetype in (Bug, Epic, Retro, Risk, Spike, Story, Task, Defect, <etc>)  {code}
fields.summary: Kanban board should bring only statuses from the projects workflows of the issues returned by the filter

fields.description: We would like to have the ability of toggle on/off sprint feature in company-managed projects as we have in the team-managed projects.
fields.summary: We would like to have the ability of toggle on/off sprint feature in company-managed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Moved from: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-2460]

Original description:

The Jira Software Cloud REST API states that "get board" request should return the board's admins but they are not contained in the received response.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # n/a

h3. Expected Results

n/a
h3. Actual Results

n/a
h3. Workaround

n/a
fields.summary: Get board by id does not return admins of the board as listed in the Jira Software Cloud REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using a custom date range on your Plan, grouping the view by Sprint will cause the capacity indicator to be positioned outside of the actual scheduled dates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a future Sprint on your Backlog and set the *Start date* and *End date* a month ahead of today (eg. start=05/Oct end=31/Oct)
# Go to your Plan and set the grouping by Sprints
# Change the date range to custom and set a *Relative* range of 3 months before and after today
 !date_range.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The Sprint capacity indicator should position the Sprint on the timeline coherent to its start and end date.

h3. Actual Results

The Sprint capacity indicator is out of range. Take notice that the Sprint is scheduled for Oct yet we see it positioned in July on the timeline.

 !TST7_SCRUM_-_Advanced_Roadmaps_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

This is just a visual problem so it does not mess with the scheduling logic. To avoid this you must use the default date ranges (Weeks, Months, Quarters, etc...)
fields.summary: Custom date range causes inconsistent Sprint mapping on the timeline

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Customer reported that "Find My Field" tool is reporting the incorrect status of the field *Security Level*.
The tool said "The Security Level system field is present on this issue" even though the field is not being added to any of the screens.
 !image-2021-09-10-17-15-43-214.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Apply the Security Scheme to the Project (I've tested on both Software and Service management projects)
 # Make sure *Security Level* is not added to any screens.
 # Open any Issue and *Click on the three-dot menu > Select "Find your field"*.
 # Search for *Security Level* field

h3. Expected Results
The tool will show the warning message stating that the field *Security Level* is not added to the screen. 

h3. Actual Results
The tool said "The Security Level system field is present on this issue"

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Issue with "Find My Field" tool

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Navigating to a different board and come back to the previous one does not keep the selected quick filter results, the quick filter shows as selected but the results are not from the quickfilter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 test boards
# Create a quick filter
# Navigate to board A and select the quick filter
# Navigate to board B
# Go back again to board A
# Video: https://share.getcloudapp.com/6quYblAJ

h3. Expected Results
Quick filter is remembered and selected.

h3. Actual Results
Quick filter is selected but not showing the results

h3. Workaround
Turn off and on the quick filter again or refresh the page
fields.summary: Quick filter is not remembered after navigating to another board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Advanced Roadmaps Plan it is unknown how the "Due date 01/Aug/21" is derived.

!Roadmap_2021_Aug_1_end_date_obf.png|width=471,height=358!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the relevant Advanced Roadmaps plan
 # Notice the end date is Aug 1, 2021 (Sprint end date is July 31)

h3. Expected Results

Since the tool tip says "This issue has no dates, so it's using the dates of its assigned sprints", the expectation is that the sprint end date (July 31) would be used (however, the end date is Aug 1 instead of July 31)
h3. Actual Results

The end date for the issues is Aug 1 instead of July 31.
h3. Workaround

Enter dates manually in the plan to avoid any miscalculations.
fields.summary: Roll-up feature on Advanced Roadmaps plan displays wrong date

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Story point estimate values are not summed up as expected in Team Managed project backlog when the number of the backlog issues are high.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Create a team-managed project. The project should be created with default workflow statuses -> ToDo, In Progress, Done
 2) Create about 80-100 issues in a sprint/ or backlog.
 3) Add story point estimate to some of the issues at the bottom of the sprint/backlog.
 4) Change the status of any issue at the bottom ( having story point) to any other status or change the value of the story point estimate of an issue, and immediately scroll up.
h3. Expected Results

The total sum of story point estimate per status category in the backlog should be updated as soon as the change is made.
h3. Actual Results

The total sum of story point estimate value is not updated in the backlog if we scroll up immediately after the change. It is also observed that the story point estimate value may be updated after ~1 minute.
h3. Workaround

Once the issue status or story point estimate value is changed in the backlog, wait for a couple of seconds before scrolling up to check the Story point estimate summary in the backlog.
fields.summary: Story point estimate value is not summed up as expected in Team Managed project backlog

fields.description:
Ability to add sections to the *Kanban Backlog* like the Sprint Backlog for grooming purposes. Need a Waterline Section for Refinement tickets and for many other reasons. 

Don't want to add an Epic and link items or tag tickets with labels. Want to move tickets in the backlog to different Sections. Section 1, Section 2, etc. Have the ability to rename the sections. 

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Add-another-status-to-the-Kanban-Backlog/qaq-p/784670]
fields.summary: Ability to add Kanban Backlog Sections

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On [https://github.com/atlassian/github-for-jira/blob/main/src/transforms/pull-request.ts#L50] check for issue keys on branches and PRs and them link them back.

if they’re only on the PR body, this not working properly
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # If there's no ticket IDs in the branch name or PR title, it won't look at the PR body for issue keys. 

h3. Expected Results
 # Look in the PR body for Issue keys

h3. Actual Results

No info vailable here.

h3. Workaround
At this moment, there isn't a workaround for this, will be posted here as soon its available.
fields.summary: Look in PR body for issue keys on Github integration isn't working as expected

fields.description:
Introduce a feature where an issue having a dependent is rescheduled automatically when one of the issues are posponed by a certain number of days.

E.g. ABC-123 is blocking PQR-789. If ABC-123 is postponed by 1 week on the timeline. The dependent issue: PQR-789 should also be postponed automatically.
fields.summary: Dependent issues should be rescheduled automatically by the same number of days

fields.description:
Currently, we're enabling the horizontal scrollbar on boards but it used to auto-size to fit the current screen size.

It would be awesome to have an option to enable/disable that feature.
fields.summary: Disable horizontal scrollbar on board

fields.description:
we would like to use a plan to define a single set of Releases and be able to easily spread this information on a number of JIRA projects. That feature was available and predefined in the previous live plan view. 

Today, we can create JIRA Versions in the cross-project Releases or link existing Versions to Releases.

it would be good if the *"Apply updates to projects" could automatically create Versions* required, perhaps asking confirmation to the user, *whenever no existing version matches the release* (name, start/end) being applied. The advantage would be to save considerable time as one can avoid defining all the Versions in all my source JIRA projects

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cross-project releases should automatically create fix version on the projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When loading the all board dashboard, board admins for certain boards are visible.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the All Boards list.
 # Check for the Board Admin column

h3. Expected Results

The Board Admins should be loaded and their names displayed on the list.
h3. Actual Results

Some Boards do show the Admin names and other don't

h3. Workaround
Open the Board and check the owner on settings
fields.summary: Board admins not appearing on all boards dashboard

fields.description:
The text editor in Confluence lets you insert an "action item", i.e. a list of checkboxes. This is useful to have tasks that you can tick out when done.

This suggestion is about having exactly the same in the Jira issue editor for simple tasks in bullet points that don't warrant a sub-issue.

Also see [this dicussion|[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/Action-items-in-Jira-issue-editor/qaq-p/1798552]]. Related: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-18407
fields.summary: Action items in Jira issue editor

fields.description:
Problem definition:
Horizontal scroll in the Jira boards is unwanted by some customers

Suggested Solution:
Create a configuration to toggle this feature ON and OFF.

Why is this important:
Users that do not have many statuses are forced to horizontally scroll to see the final status.

Workaround:
Use the horizontal scroll.
fields.summary: Board horizontal scroll ON and OFF option

fields.description:
If the Epic Link field is missing on the screen when creating issues from the Roadmap, issues go to Backlog and do not have any Epic Link value.

To fix the issue, Epic Link field should be on the create issue screen as that will populate the value and the resulting issue remains on the Roadmap screen.
fields.summary: Epic Link field to be populated when creating child issues from Roadmap page

fields.description: Currently, the horizontal x-axis in a Burndown Chart is displayed 24 hours per day. If it were possible to display only business hours (ex. 9:00 - 18:00), the chart would be more accurate to the actual work.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the horizontal x-axis in a Burndown Chart

fields.description:
Currently, Jira lacks of the ability to add custom fields Releases/Versions to capture additional information against releases

Suggestion:

Allow Project administraors/Jira administrators to add custom fields to releases/versions to capture addional information against releases. Few examples:
 * Release custom fields
 * Release comments
 * Release approval status
 * Audit history of changes to release and its scope
 * etc
fields.summary: Allow Project administrators to capture additional fields against a version/release.

fields.description:
Currently we do not capture the change the change log when there is a change to a release or its scopes. 

Suggestions: 

Have an audit history for each release that tracks changes made to a version or its scopes.
fields.summary: Audit history of changes to Project version and its scope

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the default Find shortcut on a TM project overrides browser's search function
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a team managed project
 # Use the default browser Find/Search shortcut

h3. Expected Results

Open the browser search window, of the user is looking for content inside the loaded page.
h3. Actual Results

Search goes to the Jira's search bar to filter issues, which may not be what the user is looking for.

!image-2021-09-06-17-53-46-703.png!
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, the user could open the search dialog manually.
Another option is to use Next (find) shortcut (Cmd+G)
fields.summary: Using the default Find shortcut on a TM project overrides browser's search function

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, when accessing the Roadmap, all Epics are collapsed by default.
h3. *Suggestion*

Add an option to expand/collapse all Epics, so it won't be necessary to expand one by one.
fields.summary: Ability to expand/collapse Epics on the Roadmap

fields.description:
When using the Release button you have the option to move the open issue to the next release.
This action updates the FixVersion field, which triggers Issue Updated notification, sending emails to users on that notification Scheme.

!image-2021-09-06-11-57-47-842.png|width=603,height=319!

Having the option to suppress this event can prevent users from getting multiple undesired notifications, as it is triggered 1 for each issue.
fields.summary: Have the option to suppress the notifications when releasing a version.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On the Brazilian Portuguese Kanban board, the link to "Looking for an older issue?" contains translation errors.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Jira on PT-BR language
 # Access a Kanban Board
 # Board settings must have
 Hide completed issues older than:
 1, 2 or 4 weeks.

h3. Expected Results

We should read:
 _Procurando um item mais antigo?_
h3. Actual Results

Reads:
 _Procurando uma item mais antiga?_

!image-2021-09-06-09-56-36-110.png!

h3. Workaround
Currently none.
fields.summary: Incorrect translation on PT-BR Kanban board

fields.description: In Jira expressions (used, among other things, in Conditions and Validators), it would be useful to be able to run a JQL search, for example to look for "similar" issues to the current issue, or to limit the number of issues in a certain status, etc.
fields.summary: Allow running of JQL search in Jira expressions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue bars on the roadmap appear off by half a day when dragged on the timeline. I.e., it is not possible to properly align a bar with the start or end of a dat on the timeline, because it will always be half a day off. This also happens when only the start or end of a bar is dragged, which then causes either the start or end date to be off by 0.5d

The dates still get correctly updated on the issue, though, and a page refresh fixes the visual misalignment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a roadmap
 # Try to move the bar of an issue on the timeline. To make the issue more visible, try to align the issue with one of the vertical lines in the background (e.g., the end of a month, when viewing the roadmap by months)

h3. Expected Results
# The issue bar's start date lines up with the beginning of a day, the issue bar's end date lines up with the end of a day. Thus, bars can be aligned correctly to the columns in the background of the timeline.

h3. Actual Results
# Issue bars appear to be off by 0.5d after dragging

h3. Workaround
# Refresh the page after issues have been dragged to their desired position to resolve the visual discrepancy
fields.summary: Moving an issue bar on the roadmap causes the bar to be off by half a day

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

Some companies have the requirement to have multiple Epic issue types. If the user creates a new issue type, it's not possible to have the same behaviour as default Epic.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to create new Epic issue types
h3. Workaround

N/A
fields.summary: Add the ability to create new Epic issue types

fields.description:
*Description*: 
It is easy to mix up "Parent" (which is the parent issue of a sub-task) and "Parent Link" (which is the parent issue for any issue in the hierarchy at "Epic" level or above)

*Suggestion*:
Have a consistent way of showing the relationship between an issue and its parent irrespective of where it sits in the hierarchy
fields.summary: Consistent naming convention across Parent, Parent link and Epic

fields.description:
h3. Problem

At this moment, Advanced Roadmaps plan doesn't offer a feature to filter a specific list of Issue keys.

The *Issue details* option under *Filters*, should allow it but thing is that even setting a list of issue keys separated by coma, it seems that the filter searches using wildcard as default in end of each issue key.

If I have the following list of issues in a plan:

ABC-1, ABC-2, ABC-3, ABC-4, ABC-9, ABC-10, ABC-22, ABC-23, ABC-34.

When using Issue details to filter only "ABC-1, ABC-2", the the plan will show up issues ABC-1 and ABC-2 but also ABC-10, ABC-22 and ABC-23, that are not intended.

  !Screen Recording 2021-09-02 at 08.12.45 PM.gif|width=956,height=770!
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow *Issue details* to filter specific issue keys only. 

 
h3. Workaround
 * Set a label only to the specific issues you want to be able to filter in the plan.
 ** Under *Filters*, select the desired label in the *Labels* option
fields.summary: Allow Filters feature in Advanced Roadmaps plan to match only specific issue keys

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Pull requests might simply fail to sync between GitHub and Jira when using the [GitHub for Jira integration|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1219592/github-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview].

Other development information are synced correctly:
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-01 at 10.44.15 (1).png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-09-01 at 10.44.25 (1).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a pull request on GitHub's side, setting the key on an issue on the PR title
* Check the development panel of that issue whose key you put on the PR title

h3. Expected Results

The PR will be synced between GitHub and Jira, and the information will be displayed on the development panel.

h3. Actual Results

No information about the PR is displayed on the development panel on Jira's side.

h3. Workaround

It seems that performing a manual sync forces the information from the PR to be synced in most of the cases: *https://<YOUR_SITE>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/com.github.integration.production/github-post-install-page*
fields.summary: Pull requests fail to sync through the GitHub integration sporadically

fields.description:
Users can't sort the plan scope using any custom field on Advanced Roadmaps 

For the types 'number' and 'single select' this was solved with https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-19689 . 

However we also have the need to sort & filter on other types of custom fields.
fields.summary: Allow user to sort & filter the plan scope using any custom field type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Complete Sprint* button appears on the board of a team-managed project even if *Sprints* feature is not enabled in the project. Clicking that button throws an error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a *Team Managed* project with *Kanban* project template.
 # Ensure from _Project Settings -> Features_, that _sprints_ are *not* enabled.
 # Go to the board and note that there is a *Complete Sprint* button despite this being a *Kanban* board. Click that button.

h3. Expected Results
 * *Complete Sprint* button shouldn't appear in Kanban boards.

h3. Actual Results
 * A *Complete Sprint* button appears and clicking that throws an error.
 !Image 2021-09-01 at 8.24.06 PM.jpg!

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Complete Sprint appears on a Kanban board of Team managed (Next Gen) projects

fields.description:
Completed issues (where the status is Done and resolution is set) should not be allowed to drag and drop from Active Sprint to a Future Sprint.

Currently, when an issue is already completed in an active sprint, we are able to drag and drop it to a Future Sprint, but after dropping the issue into Future sprint, the issue is no more visible on the scrum board which is fine as it is following the theory of sprint planning. But ideally, completed issues should not be allowed to move from Active to future sprints on a Scrum board in the first place.
fields.summary: Completed issues should not be allowed to move to a future sprint

fields.description: From active sprints, the issue status lozenges (indicators) are unfilled whereas from issue navigator results they are filled in (coloured). The request is to have consistency and fill in the status from active sprints, the same as in issue navigator results.
fields.summary: Status lozenges on active sprints page should be filled in the same as on issue navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes builds / deployments / pull requests etc. can be incorrectly associated with an issue (e.g. used the wrong issue key in a commit)

It would be good to have the ability to remove those incorrect associations so that the linked data is correct.
fields.summary: Allow builds / deployments etc to be removed from an issue

fields.description:
The releases off-track and on-track information is only available in the releases view, it would be helpful to be able to add it in the normal view from the plans to have more visibility at the issue level.
 !image-2021-09-01-18-00-03-502.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Advanced roadmaps: Add on-track/off-track release information into the main plan view

fields.description:
It seems that the Progress bar (issue count) doesn't display for related issues from different projects:
 !Screen Shot 2021-09-01 at 18.12.44.png|thumbnail! 

It would be awesome to display the progress bar for all issues regardless of the project.

(i) It is not specified on the [documentation|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/track-progress-using-issue-count-in-advanced-roadmaps/]
fields.summary: Progress bar (issue count) doesn't display for related issues from different projects

fields.description:
We currently are experiencing +*numerous*+ issues where users get the red box on bottom left corner that says "Something's gone wrong Our Team has been notified. If the problem persists please contact Atlassian Support" and all that simply means is they are not logged in. 

 

Can that be changed to be more specific and give some instructions - "Your are currently not logged in, please use the login (insert symbol), if you still experience issues please contact Atlassian Support. 

Attached is a copy of the error and then the image I send back to the user showing them what the problem is. 

We typically see this more with folks that don't use Jira much, but have to use Tempo for logging time. So they go to log time to a ticket and get this error and have no idea what to do. 

This week alone, I have responded to well over 20 users that have run into this. 

Thank you, 

Lori Rogers

 

!image-2021-09-01-15-29-32-467.png!

!image-2021-09-01-15-30-05-469.png!!image-2021-09-01-15-29-53-274.png!
fields.summary: Change the "Something's gone wrong" error box when user just needs to login

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some customers are currently unable to complete sprints. Most of the cases seem to be related to *team-managed* projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Try to complete a sprint on a team-managed project
* Click on the *Complete sprint* button either on the backlog view or in the board view

h3. Expected Results

The sprint will be completed.

h3. Actual Results

In some cases, nothing happens. If you try doing so from the board (active sprint) view, you will be redirected to the backlog, but the sprint will still be there.
 
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Customers unable to complete sprints

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you try to access the URL of an already deleted Software Board, the error message suggests that the Board already exists but it won't have a location.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Software Board (Kanban or Scrum)
 # Copy its URL
 # Delete the Board
 # Try to access the copied URL

h3. Expected Results
A message displaying that the Board was deleted.

h3. Actual Results
!image-2021-09-01-10-36-09-659.png|width=323,height=309!

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When accessing an URL of a deleted Board, there is a Board not accessible error message

fields.description:
Currently the feature of grouping by Sprint has the following rules:
{panel}
1. Completed sprints are all pushed to the top
2. When there are start dates for the sprints, the sprints are sorted by start dates
3. When there are no dates on the sprint, the sprint is sorted by ranking (order in the backlog)
4. Sprints across projects are still sorted by dates
5. When the dates are the same, the team name and sprint name comes into consideration
6. When there are no dates, sprints across projects get kind of squished together by ranking, e.g Proj1-rank1 => Proj2-rank1 => Proj1-rank2 => Proj2-rank2. There is no meaningful way to compare these sprints that have no dates across projects.
{panel}

This makes the sorting really complex, it would be better to for example take as the main rule the name of the Sprints or if they are from the same board.
fields.summary: Make advanced roadmaps grouping by Sprints more simple

fields.description:
Triggered by [https://www.linkedin.com/posts/maarten-dalmijn_scrum-agile-activity-6838433931004518400-wj8V] 

This widget overly focuses on output while disregarding the importance of the Sprint Goal in Scrum Teams.

Improvement suggestion: Add current Sprint Goal to this widget.

Further improvement (may be seperate feature): Extend Sprint Goal from a text box to its own entity, with further description, possibility to add comments and attachments and most importantly, metrics! The metrics should be exposed to the widget too. 

Room can be made by removing (or making configurable) the 'focus on type x' line. Does not add much value in most situations I can think of. 

 

PS I hope I selected the right component. Please help to refine/improve this issue!
fields.summary: Sprint Goal: give it the attention it deserves/needs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Time-out errors when releasing a large number of issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the *Releases* page
# Select a version with around 600 issues (number may vary)
# Click on "Release"

h3. Expected Results
Issues are released and a new *Version* is created.

h3. Actual Results
The release takes a long time due to the number of issues and a time-out error is displayed.

h3. Notes
The error is only at the UI level, though, and the operation continues in the back end. The new Version is created and released, and all issues are updated as expected. Refreshing the board will confirm that - released issues are no longer visible.

h3.Workaround
Refreshing the board should confirm that released issues are no longer visible.

(i) Ensure the board is set to filter out issues that already have a released fixVersion set by configuring the _Kanban board sub-filter_ with:
{code:borderStyle=solid} 
fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY
{code}
fields.summary: Timeou errors when releasing a large version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Move to Done" button is showing up on the board even though the Story is already in a Done status with a resolution set and all its subtasks are also done.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a story and add sub-tasks to it
 # Complete all sub-tasks and also move the parent story to Done

h3. Expected Results

The "Move to Done" button should disappear as the Story is already completed
h3. Actual Results

The Move to Done is being displayed even though the Story is already completed along with its sub-tasks.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Move to Done" button showing up for completed issues in a Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently multiple scenarios can be configured. But comparing the multiple scenarios is not supported.

h3. Proposed solution
Implement the feature to compare multiple scenrios of a plan. Currently, the user has manually go back and forth to see and compare the scenarios.
fields.summary: Ability to compare multiple scenarios

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

First epic on the basic roadmap list is not showing the Done status lozenge
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Epic status is set to Done
 # Epic is first on the list in basic Roadmap
 # The Epic will not have the done status lozenge

h3. Expected Results

Done status lozenge should be available with all Epics in the list.
h3. !image-2021-08-31-13-14-17-585.png|width=156,height=125!
h3. Actual Results

Done status lozenge is missing for the first Epic in the list of basic roadmap.
!image-2021-08-31-13-14-09-955.png|width=210,height=206!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Done status lozenge is missing for first Epic in basic roadmap list

fields.description:
don't put "1 Give feedback" into clipboard when user tries to copy jira case with title

it works as expected when Jira issue is opened in its own page (copying case number and title doesn't insert "1 Give feedback" in between them), but it doesn't work Jira case is opened as pop-up in board
fields.summary: don't put "1 Give feedback" into clipboard when user tries to copy jira case with title

fields.description:
Hi,
 # Cannot find the escalation for repair. There is a possibility to create IA, but repair process is not included.
 # When L3 is assigning a task to another level, after that L3 cannot get into it, therefore cannot make any changes, add info.
 # Could not find a field to record into the invoice number? (on setting the Asset) 

Thank you,

Enikő Csakarov
fields.summary: Sykes Budapest Alesforce UAT suggestions

fields.description:
Sharing a team makes it appear as an available option in the Teams list to every other project and Plan board including those not involved in the Plan where the team was created. This can create white noise and/or confusion in the unrelated projects/plans.

There is no current workaround at the moment other than keeping the Team as Private, however Private teams don't seem to be available in card walls or issue edit views
fields.summary: Teams need a 3rd sharing option between Private and Shared (with everyone)

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*:

Currently when deleting a team it does not warn you if the team has any assignments, it just removes the Team from the assigned tasks silently.

*Suggestion:*
Warn to indicate that the Team to be deleted has related assignments
fields.summary: When deleting a Team system should warn if Team has related assignments

fields.description:
Currently, in Jira, you cannot use the Parent Link field as a statistic type on any Dashboard gadgets nor does it support sorting via JQL (ORDER BY Parent Link ASC).

Message displayed on SORT by:
{quote}Field 'Parent Link' does not support sorting.{quote}

Proposed solution
Include the Parent Link field to Jira's supported field for sorting and statistic type on gadgets for better reporting.
fields.summary: Parent Link field not supported for sorting or gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you use the "Wrap left" or "Wrap right" image property inside a comment the edit and delete buttons are ordered alongside the image.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert an image in a comment
 # Edit it and use the "Wrap left" or "Wrap right" option and save
[Video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/Apu9YAKr]

h3. Expected Results
The edit, delete, and emoji buttons should stay at the bottom.

h3. Actual Results
The buttons are ordered alongside the image

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When you use the "Wrap left" or "Wrap right" image property inside a comment the edit and delete buttons are ordered alongside the image.
Weak validation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, the auto-scheduler in Advanced roadmaps will either consider all issues on a dependency chain if you check them all, or completely ignore unselected issues (including their start and end dates).

That makes it impossible to use scenarios where you want to use an issue as an anchor, that is, as a reference to have all other issues scheduled around its dates. Even if you select that same issue when auto-scheduling, its dates will be overwritten to adapt it to all other issues.

Check the following recording to see an example:   [^Auto-scheduler.mp4] 
* On that case I wanted the issues to be scheduled around *RU-1093*

h3. Suggestion

Provide the ability to use one or more issues as anchors so other issues are scheduled around them instead of modifying those issues' dates (specially when they have a pre-defined start and end date already).
fields.summary: Ability to use issues an anchors when using the auto-scheduler in Advanced roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The visibility of a board seems to depend on the permissions of the location project of the board rather than the "Browse Project" permissions for the respective projects present in the board filter
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*1*. Create two Jira Software projects (scrum/kanban any) where you must have Browse Project permission. (lets say ProjectA and ProjectB) and create and assign some issues in bot the projects.
 *2*. Now create a new filter and save it.
{quote}"assignee = currentUser()"
{quote}
*3*. Share the filter (created in step2) with every logged-in user. 
 *4*. Create a new Kanban Board from the previously saved filter.
 *5*. Locate the board in ProjectA
 *6*. If you remove "Browse Project" permission for ProjectA, the board will not show any issues.
h3. Expected Results
 - Load the Board
 - You should see all the tickets assigned to you, from ProjectB, project,A and rest.

h3. Actual Results

Board is empty.
 !Screenshot 2021-08-26 at 2.17.20 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

A user must have "Browse Project" permission for the project where the Board is located.
fields.summary: Visibility of a board seems to depend on the permissions of the location project of the board rather than the "Browse Project" permissions for the respective project present in the board filter

fields.description:
I would be nice to have option to enable all the issue link types available in the Basic Roadmap .
As of now, only issue link type "block" is supported in the basic roadmap

https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/manage-epics-on-the-roadmap/
fields.summary: Enable issue link type for basic roadmap

fields.description:
While there is a commentedBy field in jql, it does not work.

And in [one of the more recent questions |https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/CommentedBy-CommentedOn-don-t-seem-to-work/qaq-p/1239752]the accepted answer is to use a paid app, but if the field exists I dont see why it doesnt work and I need to get a paid app.

My use cases are:
1. looking for an issue I commented on but wasnt assigned to
2. looking for an issue someone else commented on
fields.summary: jqls commentedBy does not work

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be great, if Jira can provide us configuration to stop selected users logging time on closed ticket.

Currently it becomes very tedious to find if user has logged any time after the ticket was closed.

Also this makes a huge gap between accounting and support department to bill the customer appropriately.
fields.summary: Stop selected agents to comment or log time on Closed tickets.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

Currently, when a new version is released on a software project, the administrators have basic tools to document release notes within a project and they would need to copy the release notes if it needs to be emailed.
h3. Feature request:

1. Allow the project administrator to configure an auto email to stakeholders with release notes when a new version is released.

The administrators should be allowed to select the stakeholders from the list of users/project/issue roles like:
 * Assignees/reporters/watchers of issues in the version
 * Project Lead
 * Or any Project roles defined in the project.

2. Allow The project admin to configure a template on the project that will be used for all future releases. 

3. Allow additional issue fields to be added to the Release notes along with the issue key and summary of the issue that's currently available.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to configure email notification with release notes when a new version is released

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Atlassian has introduced the [Cycle time report|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/strategies-to-reduce-your-cycle-time/], which enables team to track the time it takes for issues to be shipped trough their deployment pipeline.

Currently, the report considers all issues rather than using the current board's filter as other reports do.

h3. Suggestion

Provide the ability to apply the filter of the current board where you are viewing the report.
fields.summary: Ability to have the Cycle time report consider the board's filter

fields.description:
Deleting a user from an instance removes the filters associated with that user.

If the filter is associated with a board, it makes the board unusable.

Ownership of the filter should be passed to other user instead of removing it.
fields.summary: When removing a user, change the ownership of filters instead of deleting them.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The state in the development panel of Pull Request says It was rejected while in Github it is Merged
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a PR and send it to review
 # Add some reviewers
 # One of the reviewers mark the PR as commented and the rest as Approved
 # The PR state is Merge while in Jira is rejected.

Jira backend response: 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

 Fetching the PR data from Github via API and I got these results:
{code:java}
Github endpoint:
https://api.github.com/repos/XXXXXXX/yyyyyy/pulls/2232/reviews
{code}
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

Per the GitHub documentation, the possible status for reviewers are:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
*Reference*

Checking this Github's documentation:
[https://docs.github.com/en/github/collaborating-with-pull-requests/reviewing-changes-in-pull-requests/about-pull-request-reviews]
h3. Expected Results

Both states must match but Github documentation is not explicit about the response of reviewers
h3. Actual Results

States do not match. Jira says Declined.
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: The state of Pull Request on Jira Development panel mismatches with Github

fields.description:
*New-Issue View*

 

Issue description or comment textareas can be confirmed/saved by pressing [Ctrl] + [Enter] (without having to use the mouse). --> This does *not* apply to the work log overlay's work description.

 

!image-2021-08-19-16-26-57-063.png!
fields.summary: Log work overlay cannot be confirmed with Ctrl + Enter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Sprint Board, issue links don't work if swimlanes are defined by Story and user filter is applied, also right-click is disabled.

Please see the attached video for more details:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a sprint board to use swimlanes by story
 # Go to the Active sprints view
 # filter by a user
 # links and right-click are not working

h3. Expected Results

Links and right-click should work
h3. Actual Results

nothing is done, video attached for reference
h3. Workaround

clear the filter or right-click the issue type icon, click copy issue link, open a new browser tab  and paste the link
fields.summary: On Sprint Board, issue links don't work if swimlanes are defined by Story and user filter is applied

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Complete sprint option visible to a viewer in Team anaged project.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set your team managed project access to "Limited"
 # Assign a standard "Viewer" role to some user.
 # Login as this user
 # Go to Backlog page. "Complete sprint" button is absent which is expected.  
!image-2021-08-19-00-13-28-110.png|width=469,height=157!
# Go to Board page.

h3. Expected Results
"Complete sprint" button should not visible on the board, just like on the Backlog page.

h3. Actual Results
The "Complete sprint" button is still available on the board, however, clicking on this does give an error, on checking the console logs we see that it happens due to the permissions(which is correct).
 !image-2021-08-19-00-14-06-464.png|width=410,height=189!!image-2021-08-19-00-17-40-530.png|width=387,height=203!

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: [Board] Complete sprint option visible to a viewer in Team managed project.

fields.description: in Advanced Roadmaps, we want the ability to sort your issue by the field "Components" in order to group the issues that have the same Components together.
fields.summary: in Advanced roadmaps, include the ability to sort by the Field Components

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When selecting any quick filter from the backlog, and switching from Active sprint to backlog section, the quick filter shows as selected however the results are not filtered. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a quick filter for the backlog.
 # Select the quick filter.
# Navigate to the Active sprint of the same board.
# Navigate back to the Backlog. 

h3. Expected Results
Previous results from the selected quick filter should be visible in the backlog.


h3. Actual Results
Results are not filtered, however, the quick filter is shown as selected.

h3. Workaround
Unselect and select the quick filter again in the backlog.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in the quick filter results when switching between Active Sprint and backlog.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Exiting a plan and entering again causes the release overdue indicator in the Gantt to show green even if it should indicate a conflict in red.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a plan where the dates are rolled up and the issues are in sprints past the release date.
# Refresh the page and the overdue indicator will turn green as if the sprint dates were not conflicting with the release dates.

h3. Expected Results
The overdue indicator should work at all times

h3. Actual Results
* The indicator shows green when it should be red when the page is refreshed.
 !toggling-roll-up-dates-off-tracks-release.gif! 

h3. Workaround
* The dates roll-up must be disabled and re-enabled for the indicator to show the right color.
* It seems that the problem only happens if a project is used as the issue source instead of a board.
fields.summary: Reloading a plan causes off-track release markers to render in green instead of red

fields.description:
As a user of Advanced roadmaps, it would create different hierarchies for different teams. If we can configure the hierarchy system of Advanced roadmaps per project. This way, we can have different hierarchy levels on Jira software.
E.g. 
|Hierarchy |Project A| Project B| Both share the same issue type scheme|
| 1st level| Project | Feature | Agile issue type scheme | 
| 2nd level | Feature | Theme |  Agile issue type scheme |
| 3rd level| Theme | Project |  Agile issue type scheme|
| 4th level| Epic | Epic |  Agile issue type scheme|

Right now, you can only configure 1 hierarchy for the entire instance and every project needs to share that hierarchy.
fields.summary: As a user I want to have the ability to make Advanced roadmap hierarchy configurable per project on Jira software

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Kanban Backlog doesn't load the issues

!kanban_backlog_issues_not_displayed.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

Production
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Access board backlog
h3. Expected Results

Load the backlog.
h3. Actual Results

Backlog not loading
h3. Workaround

Contact Atlassian Support
h3. Notes
fields.summary: Kanban Backlog doesn't load the issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In this issue, an archived version is visible under the *Recent versions* section of the *Fix versions* field dropdown menu. This allows the version to be searched and added to issues. 

Here are the prerequisites for this bug to be triggered:
 # A version is initially not in an *archived* state.
 # A full view of an issue should be open in a browser tab at the time the version is still not in an *archived* state.
 # Once the version has been archived, the browser page of the issue should not be refreshed. And then select the *archived* version (either from the *unreleased* section or the *recent* *versions* section). This action triggers the archived version to be 'saved' in the *recent versions* section and then can be used in other issues. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

There can be several ways to reproduce this.

*Replication # 1*
 # On the Release list page, create a version with a start date and end date of your choice.
 # Create an issue and open it in a new browser tab. (Let's call this issue A).
 # Check the *Recent Versions* section of the *Fix Versions* field and you will find the created version. (Do not refresh this page.)
 # Go back to the *Release* list page and archive the created version.
 # Go to issue A's browser tab and select the archived version from the *Recent Versions* section of the *Fix Versions* field. (This 'saves' the archived version on the *Recent Versions* that allows it to be used by other issues).
 # Create another ticket and open it in a new tab. (Let's call this issue B).
 # Select the archived version from the *Recent Versions* section of the *Fix Versions* field.

*Replication # 2*
 # In the Release list of your project, create a version with a start date and end date of your choice.
 # Create an issue using the Create button (Let's call this issue A).
 # Select 5-6 other versions in the Fix versions field (that is not what you created in step#1) for issue A. This is to replace all the versions under the *Recent versions* section for the Fix versions field dropdown menu.
 # Create another issue and open it in full view in a new browser tab. (Let's call this issue B)
 # In the *Fix versions* field, observe that the version created in step#1 is no longer in *Recent versions*, but only under the *unreleased* version section only of issue B. Do not refresh this page.
 # Go back to the Release list, in the same browser tab you used for Step # 1.
 # Archive the version you created.
 # Go to the tab you have for issue B and select the archived version. The archive version should only be visible under the *unreleased versions* in the Fix versions field dropdown menu. (This 'saves' the archived version on the *Recent Versions* that allows it to be used by other issues).
 # Create another issue and open it in full view in a new browser tab. (Let's call this issue C)
 # In the *Fix versions* field of issue C, observe that the archived version is in the *Recent versions* section and can be selected.

h3. Expected Results
 * Archived versions should no longer be visible in the Fix Version field menu of any issue.

h3. Actual Results
 * The archived version is still visible in the *Fix Version* field of an issue, under the *Recent versions*.
 * The archived version selected could not be removed from the fix version field.

h3. Workaround

To prevent the bug to be triggered:
 * If there were open issues in your browser tabs before a version is *archived*, refresh these browser pages. This will remove the archived version from the *Fix Version* field and will prevent you as a user to select this *archived* version. In the below steps, I added the{color:#00875a} *refresh the page* {color}action on Step # 5 which should prevent the bug to be triggered.

 # On the Release list page, create a version with a start date and end date of your choice.
 # Create an issue and open it in a new browser tab. (Let's call this issue A).
 # Check the *Recent Versions* section of the *Fix Versions* field and you will find the created version.
 # Go back to the *Release* list page and archive the created version.
 # Go to issue A's browser tab and {color:#00875a}*refresh the page.*{color} You will no longer find the archived version under the *Recent Versions* section of the *Fix Versions* field for this issue B. 

If the bug was already triggered and you can see the archived version from the *recent versions* section of the *Fix Versions* field, we can remove it from the selection by performing the following:
 # In any issue in the same project that is not using the archived version, choose 5 versions for the Fix versions field (other than the archived version that is visible). This step will remove the archived version from the *Recent versions* section because it will be replaced by those versions you selected. 
 # Revert the Fix versions field of the issue to its original value.
fields.summary: Archived fix versions are visible and can still be selected on the fix version field
